results.name: Number of integer partitions of n whose augmented differences are strictly increasing.
comment: The augmented differences aug(y) of an integer partition y of length k are given by aug(y)_i = y_i - y_{i + 1} + 1 if i < k and aug(y)_k = y_k. For example, aug(6,5,5,3,3,3) = (2,1,3,1,1,3).
The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A325395.
link: Fausto A. C. Cariboni, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
example: For example, the augmented differences of (8,8,7,5) are (1,2,3,5), which are strictly increasing.
